com.mta.tehreer.graphics

Class Typeface

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mta.tehreer.graphics.Typeface
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Disposable

    public class Typeface
extends java.lang.Object
implements Disposable
    The Typeface class specifies the typeface and intrinsic style of a font. This is used in the renderer, along with optionally Renderer settings like textSize, textSkewX, textScaleX to specify how text appears when drawn (and measured).

    • Method Detail

      • finalizable

        public static Typeface finalizable(Typeface typeface)
        Wraps a typeface object into a finalizable instance which is guaranteed to be disposed automatically by the GC when no longer in use. After calling this method, dispose() should not be called on either original object or returned object. Calling dispose() on returned object will throw an UnsupportedOperationException.

        Note: The behaviour is undefined if an already disposed object is passed-in as a parameter.

        Parameters:
        typeface - The typeface object to wrap into a finalizable instance.
        Returns:
        The finalizable instance of the passed-in typeface object.

      • isFinalizable

        public static boolean isFinalizable(Typeface typeface)
        Checks whether a typeface object is finalizable or not.
        Parameters:
        typeface - The typeface object to check.
        Returns:
        true if the passed-in typeface object is finalizable, false otherwise.

      • createWithAsset

        public static Typeface createWithAsset(android.content.res.AssetManager assetManager,
                                       java.lang.String path)
        Creates a new typeface with the specified asset. The data of the asset is not copied into the memory. Rather, it is directly read from the stream when needed. So the performance of resulting typeface might be slower and should be used with precaution.
        Parameters:
        assetManager - The application's asset manager.
        path - The path of the font file in the assets directory.
        Returns:
        The new typeface, or null if an error occurred while creating it.

      • createWithFile

        public static Typeface createWithFile(java.lang.String path)
        Creates a new typeface with the specified file. The data for the font is directly read from the file when needed.
        Parameters:
        path - The absolute path of the font file.
        Returns:
        The new typeface, or null if an error occurred while creating it.

      • createFromStream

        public static Typeface createFromStream(java.io.InputStream stream)
        Create a new typeface from the input stream by copying its data into a native memory buffer. So it may take time to create the typeface if the stream holds larger data.
        Parameters:
        stream - The input stream that contains the data of the font.
        Returns:
        The new typeface, or null if an error occurred while creating it.

      • copyTable

        public byte[] copyTable(int tableTag)
        Generates an array of bytes containing the data of the intended table.
        Parameters:
        tableTag - The tag of the table as an integer. It can be created from string by using OpenTypeTag.make(String) method.
        Returns:
        An array of bytes containing the data of the table, or null if no such table exists.

      • getUnitsPerEm

        public int getUnitsPerEm()
        Returns the number of font units per EM square for this typeface.
        Returns:
        The number of font units per EM square for this typeface.

      • getAscent

        public int getAscent()

        Returns:
        The number of glyphs in this typeface.

      • getBoundingBox

        public android.graphics.Rect getBoundingBox()
        Returns the font bounding box expressed in font units. The box is large enough to contain any glyph from the font.
        Returns:
        The font bounding box expressed in font units.

      • getUnderlinePosition

        public int getUnderlinePosition()
        Returns the position, in font units, of the underline for this typeface.
        Returns:
        The position, in font units, of the underline for this typeface.

        public int getUnderlineThickness()

        Returns:
        The thickness, in font units, of the underline for this typeface.

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Description copied from interface: Disposable
        Releases the native memory of this object. Failing to call this method will cause memory leaks.

        Note: The behaviour of this method is undefined if called more than once on the same object.

        Specified by:
        dispose in interface Disposable
